title: Starter Motor - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

Starter Motor Installation - D54; D64; D71; D72; D74; D92; DA2; DB; DB2; DB4; DBX; DC; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DD2; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4; DP; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPA; DPZ; DR4; DS1; DS4; DSA; DSB; DSX; DT3; DT4; DU; DU3; DU4; DUY; DZ; DZA
Fit a new O-ring to the starter motor.
Damage to painted surfaces could result from inadequate care during removal or installation of the starter motor. Always protect the crankcase from damage during removal or installation.
Carefully position the starter motor to the crankcase and retain with the two bolts and tighten to
Remove any self-adhesive tape used to protect the crankcase.
Locate the starter cable to its connection pole. Fit the nut and tighten it to
